intro: Brewcaria hechtioides, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and tubular flowers. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped blooms that are typically blue or violet in color, opening in the morning and closing by midday. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Brewcaria hechtioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
